title: No Kings protest live updates: New York and Atlanta kick off nationwide day of protest
summary: Senator Bernie Sanders is set to headline a rally in Washington, D.C., where he will receive support from various Democratic officials. The event aims to mobilize voters and highlight key party issues. This gathering underscores the ongoing efforts to reinforce unity within the Democratic Party.

title: Manchester City 2-0 Everton, Brighton 2-1 Newcastle, and more: football – live
summary: Barry Glendenning will provide live updates on the Premier League matches and other games happening in the afternoon. Fans can follow along for the latest scores and highlights. Stay tuned for real-time insights from the day’s football action.

title: Fulham v Arsenal: Premier League – live
summary: Arsenal is set to face a match against a West London team, aiming to increase their lead at the top of the league. The game will feature live updates provided by Scott Murray. Fans can expect a thrilling encounter as the Gunners look to secure crucial points.

title: Manchester City’s unstoppable Erling Haaland downs Everton with double
summary: Erling Haaland scored both goals in Manchester City's 2-0 victory over Everton. This match marked Haaland's 10th and 11th league goals of the season. The win solidifies City's strong performance in the league.

title: Gone in 18 minutes: Postecoglou’s rapid exit leaves Marinakis rebuild in peril | Ben Fisher
summary: Five months after narrowly missing out on Champions League qualification, Nottingham Forest now faces a battle against relegation. Their recent performances have significantly declined, placing them in a precarious position in the league standings. The team aims to turn their fortunes around to avoid dropping down a division.
